text: The November 2018 election means that there will be a party change in the guard in the office of Governor Wisconsin -- Republican Scott Walker out, Democratic Tony Evers in. The results of the elections led to a change in the minds of the leaders of the General Democratic Party in the legislature, where the Republicans will continue to take power in the new term. Republican leaders are moving quickly to abolish some of the powers given to the Governor after the 2010 elections, when Walker won and the Republican Party gained full control over legislative power.
